One compromised computer can affect every other computer sharing a connection.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM has strong security controls at the EPAM perimeter, network servers, and desktops, and uses a firewall to filter traffic from the Internet.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"However, constant vigilance is required to protect and update IT resources with the latest patches and upgrades.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The majority of successful attacks from the Internet can be traced to vulnerabilities that people know about but haven't fixed yet.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"True or False? \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"True - It is the user's responsibility to patch and upgrade systems to ensure safe computing.\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-italic\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"5.4          Patch\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A piece of software code to temporarily fix an existing problem or vulnerability.\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"5.5          Intruders\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"5.5.1     Social Engineering\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Social Engineering is a non-technical kind of intrusion relying heavily on human interaction, which often involves tricking other people into breaking normal security procedures. The attacker uses social skills and human interaction to obtain information about an organization or their computer systems.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Most experts agree that social engineering is generally a hackers manipulation of the natural human tendency to trust. The weakest link in the information security chain is the natural human willingness to accept someone at their word. This is exactly what makes us vulnerable!\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A social engineer runs what is typically known as a \\\"con game\\\". A person using social engineering to break into a computer network generally gains the confidence of someone who is authorized access to the network, in order to help reveal information that compromises that network's security.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Various Methods\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\":\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The first and most obvious is a simple direct request.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Dumpster Diving - A term used for going through the trash (or dumpster) to obtain information that can be used to steal one's identity. It is truly amazing the things people discard that can be helpful in finding additional information about a person they are potentially targeting. Dumpster diving is not technically \\\"social engineering\\\", but it can sometimes be deployed as a step towards getting helpful information .\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Raiding Mailboxes - Once the person has selected a victim, raiding that persons mailbox can often lend additional information to be used against them. The more you know about a person, the more effective alternate means of gaining data become.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Phishing is one of the newer forms of social engineering - It involves creating and using e-mails and Web sites designed to look like those of well-known legitimate businesses, financial institutions, and government agencies to deceive Internet users into disclosing their personal information. Phishing scams typically operate counterfeit web sites that lure consumers into revealing their personal and financial data, including social security numbers, bank and credit card account information, and details of online accounts and passwords.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Impersonation - This is a method where the attacker pretends to be someone in an authoritative position. Some of the methods used during impersonation attacks include... acting as an IT support or Support Service employee, a repairman, a supervisor or manager, or a trusted third-party vendor.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Surfing Company Web Sites - A lot of corporate information can be obtained before even talking to anyone by simply surfing company web sites, like employee email addresses and phone numbers, organizational charts, executive titles, financial information and more.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Where do intruders come from?\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"How many countries are developing information warfare capabilities?\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"More than 100 countries. We have a collective responsibility to ensure that we handle this responsibly and per the mandate of our clients.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Having said this, now let's see why are we concerned about Torrent software or any P2P communication.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The importance of controlling Torrent/P2P is not limited to simply preserving bandwidth or potential copyright violation. P2P networks are fundamentally distributed and designed to easily survive the loss of any endpoints. This trait has made P2P increasingly attractive as a safe carrier for botnets. Instead of relying on command-and-control servers that can be taken down, a peer-to-peer based control structure allows a botnet to survive and provide coordination simply by using the end-points of the botnet themselves. Additionally, P2P software also exposes the endpoints directly to the internet when they were otherwise behind a Firewall and not visible to the outside world.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"This emphasizes the risk of allowing P2P traffic to run unchecked in the enterprise as it provides cover for malware to hide in the network and ex-filtrate critical organizational information.
